Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory667.jpg
Windmill Square, above the steps where paints are literally flying.
Ayla has yet to set up her canvas and perform her finishing move despite being surrounded by all three Schools.
Instead, she has started a one-versus-all debate by providing criticisms.
Ayla has said that art criticism is a dangerous matter, especially when both sides are "armed."
It is easy to express personal feelings beyond the canvases.
Dulcinea
Will that stop the war?
Mark
How's that possible? "Palette Clash" is not going to stop before we decide on an art leader.
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryJianXue.prefab
Splash!
As expected, someone has pulled the trigger on their paint sprayer, and chaos ensues.
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryJianXue.prefab
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab
Ayla dodges their attacks with her Beam Gunlance while seeking a suitable spot.
Meanwhile, the facilities and infrastructure around Windmill Square suffer.
Dulcinea
Fourteen energy reserves have stopped working, and the sewage system is completely blocked by dried paint...
Dulcinea
All infrastructure within the vicinity will break down in approximately two hours.
This is the most fierce war zone, after all...
All kinds of mechanoids are physically clashing with each other at this point.
You have to count on Ayla to stop them, or you will have to resort to force.
Mark
Oh? Have we started painting?
No matter who wins, the situation here is far from over. It will take a long time to repair the facilities here.
The art leader...
Mark...
Mark
How can I help you?
Has there always been three Schools in the war?
Mark
There were 38 Schools at the beginning of Palette Clash, but only 3 remain now after the rest were eliminated.
So... we just need a School to win?
Mark
That's right. An art leader like Cervantes will emerge after a School wins.
And the art leader will emerge...
Because you all recognize them, or because somebody will select one?
Mark turns silent. He does not respond as quickly as he did.
Slowly, he starts talking when the signal lights that represent his thinking process have stopped blinking.
Mark
You have been traveling with Mark for a while, Commandant. I know you are different from the other humans, so I will tell you, and you alone.
Mark
Cervantes was always the art leader of Constellia.
Mark
After he left, Constellia lost a leader that everyone could support, and folks started to disagree with each other.
Mark
Palette Clash is actually an art competition to select a new art leader.
Isn't this too far for a competition?
Mark
You still don't understand how important art is to this city, Commandant.
Mark
We'll close our workshops and throw away our batteries and parts before we abandon our pursuit of art.
Mark
The mechanoids who aren't participating in the war aren't tired of paintings, or sculptures, or graffiti. They are only tired of fighting.
But...
Dulcinea
Is all of this... really worth it?
Mark
I'm not sure I understand you, Dulcinea.
Mark's tone changes drastically as if Dulcinea's question has touched a sore spot.
You cannot tell if Dulcinea has noticed that, but still, she keeps speaking.
Dulcinea
I can't stop you, but Palette Clash's damage to the city is tangible. It is possible for the war to get out of control.
Dulcinea
Constellia is at the critical stage of entering coexistence with humanity.
Mark
Are those the reasons we should abandon art?
Dulcinea
I don't know. I don't really understand art...
Mark, I'm not trying to ask you to give up on art...
Mark
Ah... You still can't understand...
Mark
Mark has told you this is something you will never be able to convince us.
Mark
Humans don't understand. Constructs don't understand. Humanoid mechanoids like Dulcinea don't understand.
Mark spins around where he stands, expressing his unease.
When the signal lights that represent his thinking process stop blinking, Mark sets up his canvas, seemingly intending to put all his thoughts into his art.
As silence surrounds you, Ayla achieves victory once again in the distance.
